alert.note: Alert for Schuylkill (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 05 at 4:54PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following county, Schuylkill. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 454 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tamaqua, Shenandoah, Mahanoy City, Mcadoo, Hometown, Tuscarora, Grier City-Park Crest, Delano, Sheppton, Brandonville, Coaldale, Locust Lake State Park, New Boston- Morea, Shenandoah Heights, Ringtown, Gilberton, Kelayres, Trenton, Park Place and Mary-D. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
